itemLabel: Rosalind Scott, Baroness Scott of Needham Market

wikipedia_page.main: Rosalind Carol "Ros" Scott, Baroness Scott of Needham Market (born 10 August 1957) is a British Liberal Democrat politician, non-exec director of the National Archives and a member of the House of Lords.  Baroness Scott was president of the Liberal Democrats between 1 January 2009 and 31 December 2010 and was succeeded by Tim Farron.

response: Alumni in UK politics include the Labour Members of Parliament Rachael Maskell (Physiotherapy, 1994), and Karin Smyth (Politics, 1988); two former Leaders of the House of Lords, Valerie Amos, Baroness Amos (Applied Research in Education, 1978),‘AMOS’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and Thomas Galbraith, 2nd Baron Strathclyde (Modern Languages & European Studies, 1982);‘STRATHCLYDE’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and the Liberal Democrat peer Rosalind Scott, Baroness Scott of Needham Market (European Studies, 1999).‘SCOTT OF NEEDHAM MARKET’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 UEA is also the alma mater of the former Crossbench peer Timothy Bentinck, 12th Earl of Portland (History of Art, 1975); and the former Members of Parliament Caroline Flint (American Literature, History & Film, 1983),‘FLINT, Rt Hon. Caroline Louise’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Douglas Carswell (History, 1993), Tony Colman (International Development), Jon Owen Jones (Ecology, 1975), Tess Kingham (Education), Judith Chaplin and Ivor Stanbrook (Law, 1995).
